instruction: Explain the connection between the Kessler threshold and the unstable steady state.
output: The Kessler threshold is the point at which the debris density in Earth orbit becomes so high that collisions between objects in orbit become more frequent, leading to a runaway effect where even more debris is created. The unstable steady state in this context refers to the point at which the debris density has reached such a high level that it becomes impossible to maintain a stable orbit. The connection between these two concepts is that the unstable steady state acts as a boundary beyond which it is no longer possible to maintain a stable orbit, and any object that crosses this boundary will be subject to the runaway effect of the Kessler threshold.
